smell_analysis.justification: No completely empty diagrams were found. Page 2 contains a package element, although marked for deletion.
All visual use cases on the Use Case diagrams (Pages 3, 4) are associated with at least one actor.
No use cases with redundant or identical names were found for the same actor.
No packages contained multiple elements with the same name.
No redundant data (denormalization) was identified in the database diagrams. Shared columns like 'riik_kood' are foreign keys.
Use case naming is consistent; all visual use cases start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri').
All states in the 'Auto seisundidiagramm' (Page 10) are reachable from the Start state.
All actions in the Activity Diagram (Page 5) are reachable through the defined decision flows.
Multiplicities are present on class diagram associations (e.g., 1..0..*) and implied by crows feet in database diagrams.
No diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The largest database diagram (Page 16) has 9 tables.
No single element has 6 or more visual connections. The most connected tables (e.g., 'Auto' on Page 18, 'Tootaja' on Page 20) have 4 connections.
Diagram layout is generally balanced with no extreme distances between related elements.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No element names are too short (3 or fewer characters). The shortest class names like 'Riik' and 'Isik' are 4 characters long.
Class names are capitalized and singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Töötaja').
Attribute/column names start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_aeg').
Table names in the database diagrams are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Kasutajakonto').
No type-based prefixes (Hungarian notation) were found in element names. Standard key prefixes (PK_, FK_) are allowed.
